name: Explainer recommendations are consistent after the base model is updated

testSteps.description: Explainer recommendations are consistent after the base model is updated #1 - Zone: 1, Set Point: SAT, Recommended Value: 0.85

| 1.3 | 1.4 |
Des updates the base model
Des logs: 'updating base model'
When Des generates recommendations for "Site 1"

children.description: Des ensures that the status of the last response does equal 200
Then Des sees that the advice for Zone "1" is for "SAT" to be "0.85"
Des checks that advice matches expectations
Des ensures that "The SAT set point in Zone 1 should be set to 0.85. In Zone 2, the PAT set point can be below 1.74." does include "Zone 1"

Des ensures that "The SAT set point in Zone 1 should be set to 0.85. In Zone 2, the PAT set point can be below 1.74." does include "0.85"

userStory.narrative:
The advisor is an LLM agent, therefore:
- The output may not be deterministic
- The output may differ between runs
- The output may differ as the base model is updated
- The advisor should indicate its level of confidence

When Des generates recommendations for "Site 1"
Then Des sees that the advice for Zone "<Zone>" is for "<Set Point>" to be "<Recommended Value>"
